CodeExample.Title: Get an AppRoleAssignment
CodeExample.Summary: To get an existing AppRoleAssignment entity resource, submit an HTTP GET request of the following syntax:
CodeExample.Request: GET /<version>/myOrganization/groups/<Group.objectId>/appRoleAssignments/<AppRoleAssignment.objectId> HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose

Remarks.string: A successful response returns the 200 OK status code and a payload containing the specified an AppRoleAssignment entity resource representation.

CodeExample.Title: Create or add an AppRoleAssignment
CodeExample.Summary: To create new AppRoleAssignment entity resource, submit an HTTP POST request against the appRoleAssignments collection:
CodeExample.Request:
POST /<version>/myOrganization/groups/<Group.objectId>/appRoleAssignments/<AppRoleAssignment.objectId> HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose Content-Length : <body_length>
{ <AppRoleAssignment.property_1> : <value_1>, ..., <AppRoleAssignment.property_n> : <value_n> }

Remarks.string: A successful response returns the 200 OK status code and a payload containing the newly added an AppRoleAssignment entity resource representation.

CodeExample.Title: Update an AppRoleAssignment
CodeExample.Summary: To update an existing AppRoleAssignment entity resource, submit an HTTP PUT request, specifying a new instance of the resource in the request body:
CodeExample.Request:
PUT /<version>/myOrganization/groups/<Group.objectId>/appRoleAssignments/<AppRoleAssignment.objectId> HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose If-Match : '*' Content-Length : <body_length>
{ <AppRoleAssignment.property_1> : <value_1>, ..., <AppRoleAssignment.property_n> : <value_n> }

Remarks.string: A successful response returns the 204 - No content status code without any payload.

CodeExample.Title: Update an AppRoleAssignment's properties
CodeExample.Summary: To update selected properties of an existing AppRoleAssignment entity, submit an HTTP PATCH request, specifying a new instance of the resource in the request body:
CodeExample.Request:
PATCH /<version>/myOrganization/groups/<Group.objectId>/appRoleAssignments/<AppRoleAssignment.objectId> HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose If-Match : '*' Content-Length : <body_length>
{ <AppRoleAssignment.property_1> : <value_1>, ..., <AppRoleAssignment.property_n> : <value_n> }

Remarks.string: A successful response returns the 204 No content status code without any payload.

CodeExample.Title: Delete an AppRoleAssignment
CodeExample.Summary: To delete an existing AppRoleAssignment entity resource, submit an HTTP DELETE request, specifying a new instance of the resource in the request body:
CodeExample.Request: DELETE /<version>/myOrganization/groups/<Group.objectId>/appRoleAssignments/<AppRoleAssignment.objectId> HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose If-Match : '*'

Remarks.string: A successful response returns the 204 No content status code without any payload.
